title: Compiler panics while trying to implement `DispatchFromDyn`

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: requires-nightly
labels.description: This issue requires a nightly compiler in some way.

body:
I was playing with `DisplatchFromDyn` while I encountered a
```
thread 'rustc' panicked at 'index out of bounds: the len is 1 but the index is 1'
```

The simplest example I have producing the bug is
```rust
#![feature(unsize, dispatch_from_dyn)]

use std::marker::Unsize;
use std::ops::DispatchFromDyn;

struct Inner<'a, T: ?Sized> {
	value: &'a T
}

impl<'a, T: ?Sized + Unsize<U>, U: ?Sized> DispatchFromDyn<Inner<'a, U>> for Inner<'a, T> {}

impl<'a, T: ?Sized> Inner<'a, T> {
	fn new(value: &'a T) -> Inner<'a, T> {
		Inner {
			value
		}
	}
}

pub struct Local<'a, T: ?Sized> {
	inner: &'a Inner<'a, T>
}

impl<'a, T: ?Sized + Unsize<U>, U: ?Sized> DispatchFromDyn<Local<'a, U>> for Local<'a, T> {}

impl<'a, T: ?Sized> Local<'a, T> {
	fn new(inner: &'a Inner<'a, T>) -> Local<'a, T> {
		Local {
			inner
		}
	}
}
```
Here is [a link to the playground](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=nightly&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=4fa9dca4a55ee714d9ba07fb0f01607f).
It works if I remove the `Inner` struct and put the `&'a T` directly in `Local`.
